instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message:
Hi!

On that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board i have this problem: i have to shut off and turn on 2/3 times to start the booting process, otherwise the display stays black and the white led turns on.
When machine starts everything is ok and works fast and stable for days.

What you suggest to start checking?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PP3v42? If less that 20Kohms, trash

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message:
Thanks, tomorrow i will check!
In case, why you say trash?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message: If less that 20Kohm, very likely the MCP is pulling it down and starting to fail. Being this is a 10 year old machine, that would not surprise me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message: In fact lower than 30k (ohm scale), is a bad sign for MCP...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message: I read .35 M ohm between ground and <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message: (in case you say that is better to change the MCP i have other boards, in can simply swap it?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message:
You can never be sure about an MCP so old.
Swap it and pray.

Change <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> first, just in case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot problem
threads.message:
Changed <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> and fixed.
Big thanks to everybody!
